content.title: Femoral Endarterectomy with Iliac Stenting
content.definition: Hybrid procedure combining open common femoral artery endarterectomy with endovascular treatment of iliac artery disease in a single setting.

key_concepts.description: Combined aortoiliac occlusive disease with common femoral artery disease. CFA disease not amenable to endovascular treatment alone.
CFA requires open endarterectomy (high failure with stenting). Iliac disease can be treated endovascularly. Combining reduces procedures.
Open CFA provides direct access for antegrade or retrograde iliac intervention.

preoperative_planning.imaging: CT angiography to assess iliac and femoral disease extent

disease_assessment.cfa: Extent of plaque, involvement of profunda and SFA origins
disease_assessment.iliac: TASC classification, stenosis vs occlusion, calcification

femoral_endarterectomy.exposure: Standard groin incision, expose CFA, profunda, SFA
femoral_endarterectomy.arteriotomy: Longitudinal, extending from above disease to below
femoral_endarterectomy.endarterectomy: Elevate plaque, feather endpoints, tack if needed
femoral_endarterectomy.closure: Patch angioplasty (bovine pericardium or Dacron preferred)

iliac_intervention.timing: Usually after endarterectomy complete, before patch closure
technique: Wire across iliac disease under fluoroscopy

sequence_options.endarterectomy_first: Complete CFE, then iliac stent through arteriotomy
sequence_options.iliac_first: Treat iliac first to confirm inflow before completing CFE

technical_pearls.sheath_placement: Short sheath or no sheath - direct wire access often sufficient
technical_pearls.hemostasis: Temporary clamping above and below during intervention
technical_pearls.patch_selection: Must accommodate wire passage if intervention performed before closure

complications.iliac_dissection: Can occur during intervention - additional stenting usually effective
complications.distal_embolization: Risk during both CFE and iliac intervention

learning_objectives: Identify patients appropriate for hybrid femoral-iliac procedures
Describe the technical steps and sequencing options
Explain why CFA disease requires open treatment
clinical_pearls: CFA stenting has poor results - always endarterectomy for CFA disease
Direct access through arteriotomy simplifies iliac intervention
Completion angiogram essential to confirm good result
